body: @DImuthuUpe  I think I've figure it out. Gaussian-Application-Output has type URI_COLLECTION (which might be a misconfiguration, but we'll leave that aside for now). So when the output objects are saved, AiravataTask is calling saveExperimentOutputCollection https://github.com/apache/airavata/blob/AIRAVATA-3549/modules/airavata-helix/helix-spectator/src/main/java/org/apache/airavata/helix/impl/task/AiravataTask.java#L306-L329. I think this method also needs to be updated like the way saveExperimentOutput was updated to save outputs to either the experiment or process.
@machristie good catch. I will update the code. Thanks  for this

Hi @DImuthuUpe , I have one other request. I noticed that the output fetching processes have ProcessStatuses of STARTED (2) and then OUTPUT_DATA_STAGING (8). It would be nice if they also had a final ProcessStatus of COMPLETED or FAILED.

I can work around this by looking at TaskStatus, but it would be nicer to have a final COMPLETED/FAILED status at the Process level.

I've added some validations to the API method
- user has WRITE access to experiment
- experiment is EXECUTING
- there are no currently executing intermediate output fetching processes for the given outputNames

I also added a new API method `getIntermediateOutputProcessStatus(AuthzToken authzToken, String airavataExperimentId, List<String> outputNames)` which returns a ProcessStatus object and indicates the status of a fetching intermediate outputs. This will make it easier on clients to figure out when an intermediate output fetching process is done.
Closing this because the PR is incomplete. I will manually fetch changes from htcondor branch and merge to develop

This branch will be used as a reference implementation for Condor submissions but there are lots of un-related file changes that need to be rectified. I will extract out important code portions and create a different branch

@dinukadesilva You have to send the PR to https://github.com/apache/airavata-php-gateway/tree/develop. And this file is a thrift generated file. You might have to build it using https://github.com/apache/airavata/blob/htcondor-new/thrift-interface-descriptions/generate-thrift-stubs.sh and copy those Airavata php thrift stubs to php-gateway code base

@DImuthuUpe FYI, I'm going to work on updating saveExperimentOutputCollection to update the Process outputs. I'll also see if I can add a final COMPLETED/FAILED status to the output fetching processes.

Changed the logic for allowing fetch of intermediate outputs to require that the job itself is ACTIVE. Previously it was only checking that the Experiment was in EXECUTING state. This was a good suggestion from @eroma2014.
Thank you @pjfanning for your pro-active review, I see no immediate concerns, so will merge these and will test through if the dependency upgrades causes any issues.
Some of these may be obsolete, but will merge these and will later review and remove any unused dependencies.

thanks @smarru - another more CVE has been recently reported on jackson-databind - https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-36518 - I will log a separate issue for that - it would probably require someone with more active day-to-day involvement with Airavata to do that one

Superseded by #359.
Superseded by #360.

@DImuthuUpe can this create side effects for general job submissions. It allows creating multiple job stacks for same processes if autoscheduling is enabled in case of failed processes at job submission phase.This keeps resubmitting jobs to cluster with new jobid for requeued processes.

@isururanawaka This check is performed because there was a bug in helix core to repeatedly run the same task without termination. In such cases, there were lots of jobs with the same configuration created for the same task. If you put this logic here, there is a possibility of that bug causing the same issue for auto-scheduled processes. I do not have a better way to write this but consider the issue I mentioned and you should be able to write this in a different way while mitigating the issue.

thanks @DImuthuUpe .

Do you know whether helix cores retries with the same task object repeatedly or create a new task object? BTW unsuccessful job stacks are deleted for now except the latest one.
@isururanawaka I understand that these utilities are required for the performance measurement of your testing. I am still wondering what is the use case of exposing those through the registry

> @isururanawaka I understand that these utilities are required for the performance measurement of your testing. I am still wondering what is the use case of exposing those through the registry

@DImuthuUpe I'm thinking of some stat modules will be helpful for meta scheduler to design routing strategies in the future(https://github.com/apache/airavata/tree/develop/modules/airavata-metascheduler/metadata-analyzer). But, for now, I'm using this only for testing. once, done we can disable it.
